properties.Name: MortgageLoanSummaryAmortizationSchedule
properties.Description:
A timetable for payment of a mortgage loan. 

An amortization schedule shows the amount of each payment applied to interest and principal and shows the remaining balance after each payment is made.

Columns.Name: CreditGrantorId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Credit Grantor.

Columns.Name: MortgageLoanAccountNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer Account.

Columns.Name: PaymentNumber
Columns.Description: The payment number.

Columns.Name: PaymentDueDate
Columns.Description: The date that the payment is due.

Columns.Name: PaymentAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of the total payment.

Columns.Name: InterestAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of interest paid by the associated payment.

Columns.Name: PrincipalAmount
Columns.Description: The amount borrowed or remaining unpaid, also, that part of the monthly payment that reduces the outstanding balance of a mortgage as of the associated payment.

Columns.Name: PropertyTaxesAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of property taxes included in the payment.

Columns.Name: MortgageInsurancePremiumAmount
Columns.Description: The fee paid to FHA or a private insurer for mortgage insurance and included in the payment.

Columns.Name: TotalPitiAmount
Columns.Description: Principal, interest, taxes and insurance included in the payment.

Columns.Name: RemainingBalanceAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of principal that has not yet been repaid as of the associated payment.

Columns.Name: RemainingTerm
Columns.Description: The original amortization term minus the number of payments that have been applied.

Columns.Name: AdjustingPaymentIndicator
Columns.Description: The date when a new monthly payment amount takes effect on an adjustable rate mortgage (ARM) or a graduated payment mortgage (GPM). The payment change date occurs the month immediately after the interest rate adjustment date.

Columns.Name: GracePeriodNumberDays
Columns.Description: The number of days grace before the payment is delinquent.

Columns.Name: FixedInstallmentAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of mortgage that has first claim in the event of default.

Columns.Name: IndexMarginAdjustmentPercentage
Columns.Description:
A percentage that is added /subtracted from the associated interest rate.

The rate is adjusted in increments, called the margin, to compensate for greater credit risk or other factors that affect the cost of lending.

Columns.Name: IndexMarginAdjustmentReasonNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding the margin adjustment.

Columns.Name: MortgagePaymentTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Mortgage Payment Type.

Columns.Name: LoanRecastId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a loan recast proceeding.

Columns.Name: BillingCycleId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Billing Cycle.

Properties.Description:
A timetable for payment of a mortgage loan. 

An amortization schedule shows the amount of each payment applied to interest and principal and shows the remaining balance after each payment is made.
